tool_input.query: Jane Austen biography "Claire Tomalin" "Carol Shields" "Lucy Worsley" "Paula Byrne" Emma

tool_response.query: Jane Austen biography "Claire Tomalin" "Carol Shields" "Lucy Worsley" "Paula Byrne" Emma
results:
The web search returned information about several Jane Austen biographies by the authors you mentioned. Based on the search results, here are the relevant biographical works:

**Paula Byrne** wrote "The Real Jane Austen: A Life in Small Things" (HarperCollins, 2014)(no content)**Carol Shields** authored "Jane Austen" (Penguin, 2005; reprint 2001)(no content)**Claire Tomalin** wrote "Jane Austen: a life" (Knopf, 1999)(no content)**Lucy Worsley** is the author of "Jane Austen at home: a biography" (St. Martin's Press, 2017)

The search results also mention that there are annotated editions of Emma from Harvard University Press, specifically Emma (edited by Bharat Tandon, 2012).

Additionally, Paula Byrne wrote another work titled "The genius of Jane Austen: her love of theatre and why she works in Hollywood" (Harper, 2017).

These represent some of the most notable modern biographies of Jane Austen by distinguished authors and scholars.
